items.title: Package cloudinary-core -  Web bundle size - Can be smaller?
items.body:
## Bug report for Cloudinary Cloudinary-JS SDK
## Describe the bug in a sentence or two.

Using the latest version - bundle size kept growing over the past couple of versions.
https://bundlephobia.com/result?p=cloudinary-core@2.9.0
It is now at 82KB minified.

All I need this package is to generate the image URLs using a predefined set of transformations. Still, I have to pull in such a huge package that cannot be tree shaken using webpack.
(explicitly, I only call `config()` and `url()`)

Do I have another option to just generate the image URLs in a safe and compatible way or this is the smallest offer you have on the SDK side?
There is [this](https://github.com/esbenp/cloudinary-url-resolver) 3rd party lib for example but it does not seem well maintained and most likely could suffer from feature incompatibility.


Ideally, there would be an sdk which is event smaller than core only used for "display" purposes without the entire upload features. Even better, this packages could be tree shaken from all the code which is not required. (need to use sideEffects modifier for webpack to eliminate unused code)

## Issue Type (Can be multiple)
[ ] Build - Can’t install or import the SDK
[ ] Babel - Babel errors or cross-browser issues
[X] Performance - Performance issues
[ ] Behaviour - Functions aren’t working as expected (Such as generate URL)
[ ] Documentation - Inconsistency between the docs and behavior
[ ] Incorrect Types - For typescript users who are having problems with our d.ts files

## Versions and Libraries (fill in the version numbers)
Cloudinary-Core SDK version - 2.9.0

## Config Files (Please paste the following files if possible)
Probably not relevant

items.title: Responsive width 'null' on high DPR devices
items.body:
When using the following responsive functionality

```js
const cl = cloudinary.Cloudinary.new({ cloud_name: 'MY_CLOUD' });
cl.responsive();
```

The width is being set to `null` on DPR: 3 devices.
Let me know if you need more information.

items.title: Bug: cname is overridden by secure
items.body:
This will use `res.cloudinary.com`
```js
new cloudinary.Cloudinary({
  cname: 'media.example.com',
  cloud_name: 'example',
  secure: true,
})
```
but this will use `media.example.com`:
```js
new cloudinary.Cloudinary({
  cname: 'media.example.com',
  cloud_name: 'example',
})
```
That's because of the `if/else` logic [here](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/blob/42f9795a6f3a624ba0d3565eb8cecd30f4a55e19/src/url.js#L105-L120).

Either (a) `secure` should only control the scheme or (b) the conflict should be documented.

items.title: Cloudinary player errors after latest update
items.body:
Hello, I've been using the Cloudinary service for a few months and I found that after the latest updates to the core library(which is a dependency to the https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary-video-player) now there's an issue.

If you are loading the player files from the cdn like this:

```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/cloudinary-core/cloudinary-core-shrinkwrap.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
<script src="https://unpkg.com/cloudinary-video-player/dist/cld-video-player.min.js"
        type="text/javascript"></script>
```

You get the following error:
```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property 'VideoPlayer' of undefined
    at Object.<anonymous> (cld-video-player.min.js:1)
    at i (cld-video-player.min.js:1)
    at cld-video-player.min.js:1
    at cld-video-player.min.js:1
    at webpackUniversalModuleDefinition (cld-video-player.min.js:1)
    at cld-video-player.min.js:1
```

I might be wrong, but my implementation was working until the latest commits on this repository and since I haven't changed anything this is the conclusion I came to. I'm sorry if I am making a false alert 🗡  Please take a look.

items.title: maxFileSize for videos - unable to upload higher than 40MB
items.body:
Hi there,

When I configure the `cloudinary-direct-file` to have a high limit (e.g. 500MB), the `POST` request fails as such:

```
net::ERR_CONNECTION_RESET
```

```
POST https://api.cloudinary.com/v1_1/ralliohq/auto/upload
Referrer Policy:no-referrer-when-downgrade
Provisional headers are shown
Accept:application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
Content-Type:multipart/form-data; boundary=----WebKitFormBoundarypYQSgXlF0CYBRBkB
Origin:http://localhost:5000
Referer:http://localhost:5000/dashboard/franchisor/5/database/videos/new
User-Agent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_13_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/63.0.3239.132 Safari/537.36
X-Requested-With:XMLHttpRequest
X-Unique-Upload-Id:~~~
```

The request payload contains a public id, timestamp, signature, api_key, file - but no reference to maxFileSize. As a result, I am unable to upload any video file greater than 40MB. We're paying for the premium cloudinary service, and should be qualified for up to 1GB AFAIK. Am I missing something?

Thank you!

https://github.com/mileszim/ember-cli-cloudinary/blob/master/addon/components/cloudinary-direct-file.js#L49

items.title: Cloudinarydone not firing
The "delay" transformation gets incorrectly translated in the URL as "l" instead of "dl"

items.title: broken dependency `blueimp-file-upload` when using bower/amd
items.body:
https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/blob/6a8f2dbf6463ac00892e9e13679935ec3b76a59c/bower.json#L48

this dependency made some breaking changes in `9.12.6` which was released 10/17/2016. the jquery-ui folks updated the AMD module naming convention, but it looks like your library has hard-coded against the old naming convention.

https://github.com/blueimp/jQuery-File-Upload/commit/a9bfde1cfe7c5295b3757a28fbffe06087701749

you should either change the dependency to be max `9.12.5` or otherwise somehow fix this dependency.

items.title: Hidden input image_id (data-cloudinary-field) gets URL not public_id
items.body:
I'm a newcomer to Cloudinary so apologies if I'm misunderstanding how this should work. But using jQuery direct image upload, I was expecting that the hidden `<input>` referenced by the `data-cloudinary-field` attribute on the uploader, should be getting the `public_id` of the uploaded image. However, it is being set to a relative URL of the uploaded image, e.g. 

```
<input type="hidden" name="photo_id" value="image/upload/v1466101544/5760acba92218923ad821b98.jpg#281171ba75eb9609854470ed8befbc7894f4c799">`
```

It makes more sense to me that the public_id is added to that field, so that you could save that when accepting the form submission, and later query with `cloudinary.image(model.photo_id)`, or on client side with `$.cloudinary.image($('input[name=photo_id]').val())`. Neither works with this URL.

I can get the correct `public_id` by listening to the `cloudinarydone` event, but I was hoping to use the built-in functionality as described in the documentation:

> When uploading is completed, the identifier of the uploaded image is set as the value of a hidden input field of your selected name (e.g., image_id in the example above).

http://cloudinary.com/documentation/jquery_image_upload#direct_uploading_from_the_browser

Ideas? Thanks!

items.title: Direct upload of base64 data
items.body:
I have a functional file upload working like so: ```
``` It uploads an image that I select from my filesystem and everything works. Now I am trying to follow the steps at i) [Can I upload using DATA URI BASE64](https://support.cloudinary.com/hc/en-us/articles/203125741-Can-I-upload-using-DATA-URI-BASE64-) ii) [How to upload a Base64 DataURI string of an image directly from the browser?](https://support.cloudinary.com/hc/en-us/articles/202519992-How-to-upload-a-Base64-DataURI-string-of-an-image-directly-from-the-browser-) But can't seem to get it working. I get the error `Uncaught Error: cannot call methods on fileupload prior to initialization; attempted to call method 'option'` My code is basically the same, like so: ```
Start
``` It is failing at `$('.cloudinary').fileupload('option', 'formData').file = data;` I have also tried with `var data = "data%3Aimage%2Fpng%3Bbase64%2CiVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAHElEQVQI12P4%2F%2F8%2Fw38GIAXDIBKE0DHxgljNBAAO9TXL0Y4OHwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg%3D%3D"` but also no luck. Any idea how to get this upload working? **EDIT** I am able to get past the `prior to initialization` error by including ``` $('.cloudinary').fileupload() ``` before the failing line. However, the base64 upload still does not work, while clicking and selecting a file works fine. Now there are no errors thrown, it simply doesn't do anything.

items.title: Element not catching 'cloudinarydone' trigger
items.body:
I have a file upload that sends the file just fine, but it isn't registering the trigger afterward:

```
form
  .append($.cloudinary.unsigned_upload_tag 'cloudinary_transform', {
      cloud_name: 'mysite',
      tags: 'mytag'
    }).bind('cloudinarydone', () -> console.log 'finished')
```

I have also tried variations of

```
form
  .append($.cloudinary.unsigned_upload_tag 'cloudinary_transform', {
      cloud_name: 'mysite',
      tags: 'mytag'
    }).on('cloudinarydone', () -> console.log 'finished')
```

The image uploads just fine, and I see the data response in the console, but I'm not able to register the trigger (i.e. `finished` is never logged).

Has this been changed recently, or is there some other obvious problem?

items.title: Incorrect link in blog post
items.body:
In this [blog post](http://cloudinary.com/blog/how_to_automatically_create_images_for_responsive_design) a link is included to "[the Cloudinary JavaScript library](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/blob/master/js/jquery.cloudinary.js#L675)". 

Note that you guys linked to line 675 of the master branch, which by now has changed, thereby confusing the user.

You can use the 'y' key on your keyboard to get the current commit to prevent this, also see this documentation: 

https://help.github.com/articles/getting-permanent-links-to-files/

items.title: jquery.cloudinary.js cannot be minified
items.body:
## Steps to Reproduce
- Install the [YUI-compressor gem](https://github.com/sstephenson/ruby-yui-compressor)
- Run the following command on `jquery.cloudinary.js`, and you should be able to reproduce the error. (Adjust the path to `yuicompressor-2.4.8.jar` file if you are not using `rbenv`)

```
java -jar ~/.rbenv/versions/2.2.4/lib/ruby/gems/2.2.0/gems/yui-compressor-0.12.0/lib/yuicompressor-2.4.8.jar --type js --charset utf-8 --nomunge jquery.cloudinary.js
```
## More Details

I am using Cloudinary in a Rails application.

Recently I upgraded the cloudinary gem from 1.1.0 to 1.1.2, and the application javascripts were no longer compiling when doing `rake assets:precompile`. Version 1.1.1 of the gem exhibited the same problem. Version 1.1.0 continue to work as expected.

As part of the asset pipeline compilation process, I am using the [YUI-compressor gem](https://github.com/sstephenson/ruby-yui-compressor) to minify the application Javascript.

I am reporting the issue in this repository and not in the [cloudinary_gem](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_gem) repo, because I eventually tracked the issue down to the `jquery.cloudinary.js` file in this repository, which throws errors when being minified.

The last version of `jquery.cloudinary.js` that is minifiable appears to be in the `1.0.25` release of `cloudinary_js`, with the SHA of `109ff78056b161e8260b52b779554750f533e3d1`, which appears to be the version present in version 1.1.0 of `cloudinary_gem`.

Below are the error messages that appear when trying to minify `jquery.cloudinary.js`:

```
vagrant@www:/vagrant/tmp/temp_repos/cloudinary_js/js$ git checkout master
Already on 'master'
Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/master'.

However, it worked on version `109ff78056b161e8260b52b779554750f533e3d1`:

```
vagrant@www:/vagrant/tmp/temp_repos/cloudinary_js/js$ git checkout 109ff78056b161e8260b52b779554750f533e3d1
Note: checking out '109ff78056b161e8260b52b779554750f533e3d1'.

You are in 'detached HEAD' state. You can look around, make experimental
changes and commit them, and you can discard any commits you make in this
state without impacting any branches by performing another checkout.

If you want to create a new branch to retain commits you create, you may
do so (now or later) by using -b with the checkout command again. Example:

  git checkout -b new_branch_name

HEAD is now at 109ff78... Update version to 1.0.25
vagrant@www:/vagrant/tmp/temp_repos/cloudinary_js/js$ java -jar ~/.rbenv/versions/2.2.4/lib/ruby/gems/2.2.0/gems/yui-compressor-0.12.0/lib/yuicompressor-2.4.8.jar --type js --charset utf-8 --nomunge jquery.cloudinary.js
(function(factory){if(typeof define==="function"&&define.amd){define(["jquery","jquery.ui.widget","jquery.iframe-transport","jquery.fileupload"],factory)}else{var $=window.jQuery;factory($);$(function(){if($.fn.cloudinary_fileupload!==undefined){$("input.cloudinary-fileupload[type=file]").cloudinary_fileupload()}})}}(function($){var CF_SHARED_CDN="d3jpl91pxevbkh.cloudfront.net";var OLD_AKAMAI_SHARED_CDN="cloudinary-
.... (the rest of the minified file) ...
```

So, something happened after the `109ff78056b161e8260b52b779554750f533e3d1` version of the file after September 1 that broke `jquery.cloudinary.js`, as far as its ability to be minimized goes.

This probably breaks a lot of Rails applications as minimization is routinely done as part of asset compilation!

items.title: Always receive invalid signature response when adding any params besides api_key, timestamp, signature, or resource_type
Trouble uploading unsigned via new jquery-file-upload
items.body:
I'm trying to do an unsigned upload that was working fine with the previous version of file upload, but now I can't seem to get it configured.  Trying to cobble together from the docs here http://cloudinary.com/documentation/jquery_image_upload

HTML

```
<script src="bower_components/jquery/dist/jquery.js"></script>
<script src="bower_components/cloudinary-jquery-file-upload/cloudinary-jquery-file-upload.js"></script>
...
<input type="file" name="file" class="cloudinary-fileupload" 
  data-form-data="%7B%22upload_preset%22:%22logo_260x60%22,%22cloud_name%22:%22mysite%22,%22tags%22:%22browser_uploads%22%7D"/>
```

JS

```
$.cloudinary.config({ cloud_name: 'mysite' })
```

The input shows up and lets me select a file, but never initiates an upload.  No errors, no message in the console, nothing.

What more is needed?

items.title: Lodash is now a dependency too?
items.body:
I'm doing file uploads from the client.  I have to include jQuery as a dependency, which I understand is being removed eventually.

In the meantime I'm maintaining my app and updating bower, and including the libraries as suggested:

```
  './src/bower_components/cloudinary-core/cloudinary-core.js'
  './src/bower_components/cloudinary-jquery/cloudinary-jquery.js'
  './src/bower_components/cloudinary-jquery-file-upload/cloudinary-jquery-file-upload.js'
```

I get `Uncaught ReferenceError: _ is not defined`

Adding lodash in front of them solves this.

**Does this mean that the file upload is now dependent on lodash and jQuery both?  Or am I missing something and there is a way around this?**

Also as feedback, our team would strongly prefer that the cloudinary libraries be fully independent of external libraries.

items.title: hard fileupload dependency introduced in 2.0.2
items.body:
This commit 7b9ee40724053abe63c7de90d6746bac89766cb8 introduces a hard dependency on the fileupload plugin. When it's not included, it crashes.
For the user app we are using cloudinary only for displaying of images, so we don't need the fileupload.
As a bonus it would be nice if there was a smaller build which doesn't include the uploading capabilities at all.

items.title: Cloudinary Upload Widget messing up button's text when using custom stylesheet
Update load-image.all.min.js to latest version
items.body:
My browser gets unresponsive if I upload a file with a invalid segment size.
This can be fixed with the latest version of `load-image.all.min.js`
https://github.com/blueimp/JavaScript-Load-Image/blob/master/js/load-image.all.min.js

items.title: this.fileupload is not a function
items.body:
2.0.1 works for me, but on 2.0.3 I get a runtime error of `Uncaught TypeError: this.fileupload is not a function`.

Error occurs at line 3307 of cloudinary-jquery-file-upload/cloudinary-jquery-file-upload.js.
![screenshot 2015-11-30 03 31 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2864564/11483655/929d84be-9777-11e5-9057-d98a95688390.png)

items.title: cloudinary-jquery doesn't work with the upload widget
items.body:
http://cloudinary.com/documentation/upload_widget

I had used both together with 1.0.25, but as of 2.0.0, the fact that they both set the window.cloudinary causes issues.

items.title: Make classname to activate 'responsive images' configurable
items.body:
Currently the classname to apply the 'responsive' functionality is [hard-coded](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/blob/0ecad1543c3447ac78a7fb5a129c7d58a9733c55/src/cloudinaryjquery.coffee#L37) to `cld-responsive`. "Why?" was the first thing that popped in to mind. Why not make it configurable while having a default value of `cld-responsive`? 

This makes the Cloudinary library less obtrusive and therefore better adoptable. For examples, all our responsive images already have assigned a classname `responsive` which can then be 'reused'.

items.title: Incorrect width used when images marked as cld-responsive are part of inactive Bootstrap TabPanes
items.body:
Based on [this nice article](http://cloudinary.com/blog/how_to_automatically_create_images_for_responsive_design), we tried to use the described responsive behaviour of images served by Cloudinary in a page that uses [Bootstrap TabPanels](http://getbootstrap.com/javascript/#tabs). This resulted in the following behaviour:
- the generated URLs for the images that are part of the initially active TabPane have proper widths: around 150 pixels for thumbnails.
- the generated URLs for the images that are part of the inactive TabPanes, the width of the TabPane (or the element containing the TabPane) is used: around 680 pixels in our design. 

The resulting images are displayed properly when a TabPane is activated. However, when being loaded an image with a bigger width than required is loaded. This kind of make using this feature useless, since we use TabPanels a lot.

Using the incorrect width is possibly caused by [this snippet of code](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/blob/f2e053c84bcb5664fec6099727df14a53fe93117/src/cloudinaryjquery.coffee#L121-L129) which traverses up to the DOM untill a proper width is found. As soon as the element is found that contains all the TabPanes, THAT width is used since that element is the first one visible... Maybe this approach is a bit 'naive'? Maybe the 'loading' process should only start when the element itself, or direct parent has a width, or make the amount of considered upper elements configurable? Then we could fire a `window resize event` as soon as a Tab is clicked...

Update, I [tested the last suggestion](https://github.com/holtkamp/cloudinary_js/commit/e002cb0cb00ae6dc4459655723b58c2581c9920f), this works properly. We take the size of the parentNode and fire a window.resize event as soon as a Tab is activated. In what scenario's would you want to traverse further 'up' the hierarchy than just the parent node of the image?

items.title: Add to CDN for easy deployment on production environments
items.body:
To use the JavaScript functionality (compliments by the way ;)) on a production environment, hosting on a CDN (with focus on JavaScript packages) would be nice instead of hosting it ourselves. 

For the time being, RawGit suits fine, this converts a GitHub URL to a CDN like approach:
https://cdn.rawgit.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/master/js/jquery.cloudinary.js

But maybe you can consider registering it at something like www.cdnjs.com?

items.title: $.cloudinary.image with width="auto" does not set the data-src attribute
problem with cloudinary_cors.html in IE8 - windows 7
items.body:
When uploading an image in Internet Explorer 8 i get an error on [this line](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/blob/master/html/cloudinary_cors.html#L39) of the cloudinary_cors.html file.

It seems that document.body doesn't have method hasOwnProperty in IE8. It's strange because the comment above this line seems to be saying that this is an explicit check to see if we are running on less than IE9. I removed the if statement and set it to always run 

```
document.body.innerText = parse(window.location.search.slice(1));
```

and now it seems to run fine.

The commit that made this change stated it was to [protect against a XSS vulnerability](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/commit/dffe2a4f35c382e0f017b791ac02f059c0120d02)

Is it safe for me to make this change or is there another cause to my problem you can think of?

items.title: NPM package?
items.body:
I'm currently using npm to manage my project's dependencies.

All of this projects dependencies have an NPM repo, why doesn't this project have an npm repo?

items.title: width and height options are not included in src
items.body:
```
    $.cloudinary.url(image_id, {width: 10, height: 10})
```

yields

```
http://res.cloudinary.com/cloud_name/image/upload/image_id.png
```

The same is true for `$.cloudinary.image`. The `src` does not include the width and height properties.

items.title: Why based on jQuery?
items.body:
Basing this library on jQuery has the big disadvantage of making it difficult to use on the server side in nodejs. Also, the nodejs library is not possible to run in the browser due to the use of node-only modules such as fs.

To me, it's not really clear why the jQuery requirement is needed?

A vanilla javascript library instead of one strict client-side and one strict server-side would be awesome.

items.title: Java direct upload BAD REQUEST error
items.body: I used Java for building **Image upload** tag: ``` Java Map options = ObjectUtils.asMap("resource_type", "auto"); options.put("callback", "http://localhost:8080/cloudinary_cors.html"); Map htmlOptions = null; String html = cloudinary.uploader().imageUploadTag("image_id", options, htmlOptions); ``` Put this String to Model attribute and show on page. Looks like ![result](http://i.imgur.com/LEgeewJ.png). Picked some image and **jquery.fileupload** tried to send this image to Cloudinary. I took **Status Code: 400 Bad Request** and response: ``` JSON error: {message: "Upload preset must be specified when using unsigned upload"} ``` All of my settings is right, I **can send** image from **server side**, using this code: ``` Java Map uploadResult = cloudinary.uploader().upload("image.jpg", ObjectUtils.emptyMap()) ``` but I **can't send** file from **client side**. **Code of page**: ``` HTML ``` I read all of your manuals, github issues, stackoverflow answers but can't force working direct upload. Please help me, deal with this problem.

items.title: Unable to upload file using AngularJS
Unable to upload when using Jquery Mobile
wrong color_space parameter conversion
items.body:
according to this support ticket, i can use the color_space parameter to convert cmyk images to rgb
http://support.cloudinary.com/hc/communities/public/questions/200788572-image-is-not-shown-at-smartphone

however, this code

``` javascript
$.cloudinary.url(myid, {crop: 'fill', color_space: 'no_cmyk'})
```

produces the url parameter **cl**_no_cmyk instead of **cs**_no_cmyk
the image is broken, if i manually edit cl to cs, i get the expected result

please fix!

items.title: How to delete a file by AngularJS?
items.body:
Hi;

Let's say I uploaded a file to my Cloudinary account. I have the url of the image. Can I delete it with AngularJS code?

items.title: Plain cloudinary.js for API-level access without jQuery

A way to cancel uploads?

items.title: Update version to include changes from fix for Issue #125
items.body: Unless I'm mistaken, a version bump didn't happen with commit b2c86d1a1f950feb0baf7298d97b485166c7583b, meaning we can't easily pull this fix from bower.

items.title: Subdomains on Secure URLs
items.body:
Just making a request for this to be implemented, if possible:

http://support.cloudinary.com/entries/25445341-Subdomain-and-ssl-certificate

items.title: Upload breaks in IE9 - `data` comes back in `data.files`, not `data.result`
items.body:
When using an iframe transport, an error occurs on this line https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/blob/master/js/jquery.cloudinary.js#L611

You can test this out in any browser by forcing iframe transport:

```
$('.cloudinary-fileupload').fileupload({forceIframeTransport: true});
```

Results come back not as `data.result` but an array of `data.files`.

items.title: cloudinary_fileupload() called upon script inclusion
items.body:
Please see this commit:
https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/commit/05cd1ec379f69719e3a01404de813a32351fe8dd

In this way `cloudinary_fileupload()` is called as soon as `jquery.cloudinary.js` is loaded which is far too early for initializing blueimpFileupload (at least in case the you wish to customize the options passed like in my case). At this point I haven't initialized `api_key` and `cloud_name` or other binding callbacks.
I want to pass more `options` so I call later on:

``` javascript
$(".cloudinary_fileupload").cloudinary_fileupload(myCustomOptions);
```

Could the maintainer explain what is the correct usage in case I want to pass my own options such as `maxFileSize`, `dataType`, `headers`?

items.title: Missing tag after fixing bower.json syntax error
items.body:
Thank you very much for fixing the syntax error with bower.json -> https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/commit/064fb900901fd84b9c3fa09a7b3a09adad1f4ec6

With the following part, I still get this syntax error via 'bower install':

```
"cloudinary": "https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js.git",
```

I suggest creating a new release (1.0.14) for this. Forking and tagging help me fixing this issue.

Kind regards
winterstefan

Using the .config() method I set the tags, but they're not being attached to the uploaded images.

```
$.cloudinary.config({ tags: "awesometag" });
```

Am I setting the tags in the incorrect place?

items.title: URL prefix when window.location.protocol is file:
items.body:
hi,

I ran into an issue where I am loading the HTML page with the `file://` protocol and would like call the `cloudinary_url` function to get the URL of the image file having the `https://` protocol.

From [the code](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_js/blob/5b9fc77e3d5d4bdf6bfc2310066ce34b1fbc78f4/js/jquery.cloudinary.js#L231), it looks like the `secure` option is ignored when the `window.location.protocol` is `file:`.

Would you consider instead, make the `secure` option overwrite that prefix to `https://` no matter what value the `window.location.protocol` has? For example, that line could be something like:

``` javascript
var prefix = secure ? 'https://' : (window.location.protocol === 'file:' ? "file://" : 'http://');
```

Thanks!

items.title: Can you please increment version of cloudinary gem? My pull request still isn't coming through.
items.body:
Hi - 

I recently submitted a pull request into cloudinary_js that was accepted.

However, in my project, the cloudinary gem that installs the javascript still has the old version even after I do bundle update.

Even if I erase the gem directory from my local machine and reinstall, I can't do that when I push to Heroku. 

Can you please help me? I'd really like to get my updates into production. Thanks!

items.title: Documentation Needed on How to upload from text input using URL
items.body:
Using the plugin works easily enough when setting up a type=file input field, but I can't figure out how to get it to work using website URL. 

I tried 

$('#url_field').cloudinary_fileupload();

but nothing happens. Can you please provide some documentation on how to use the jquery plugin with a URL rather than a file input?
